title: Workshop on Affordance-Based Design of Digital Learning Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with digital tools, fundamental understanding of language learning
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing the design of digital language learning materials in smartphone-centric, technology-constrained environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more interactive affordances of digital language learning materials (e.g., pronunciation practice, context-based vocabulary expansion) in digital environments.
Learners can design two or more mobile-friendly learning activities (e.g., quizzes, voice recordings, collaborative writing) applicable even in resource-limited technological settings.
Through project-based assessment, learners develop digital material prototypes (e.g., image-text combined cards, audio-based storytelling) tailored to real-world language learning scenarios.

resources: Free Digital Authoring Tools (Canva, Padlet, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
